ads_base_frr_ads_01.name: Public Information
ads_base_frr_ads_01.description: FedRAMP ADS > Base. Impact Levels: Low, Moderate, High
ads_base_frr_ads_01.instructions: Providers MUST publicly share up-to-date information about the _cloud service offering_ in both human-readable and _machine-readable_ formats, including at least:

ads_base_frr_ads_02.name: Consistency Between Formats
ads_base_frr_ads_02.description: FedRAMP ADS > Base. Impact Levels: Low, Moderate, High
ads_base_frr_ads_02.instructions: Providers MUST use automation to ensure information remains consistent between human-readable and _machine-readable_ formats when _authorization data_ is provided in both formats; Providers SHOULD generate human-readable and _machine-readable_ data from the same source at the same time OR generate human-readable formats directly from _machine-readable_ data.

ads_base_frr_ads_03.name: Detailed Service List
ads_base_frr_ads_03.description: FedRAMP ADS > Base. Impact Levels: Low, Moderate, High
ads_base_frr_ads_03.instructions: Providers MUST share a detailed list of specific services and their impact levels that are included in the _cloud service offering_ using clear feature or service names that align with standard public marketing materials; this list MUST be complete enough for a potential customer to determine which services are and are not included in the FedRAMP authorization without requesting access to underlying _authorization data_.

ads_base_frr_ads_04.name: Uninterrupted Sharing
ads_base_frr_ads_04.description: FedRAMP ADS > Base. Impact Levels: Low, Moderate, High
ads_base_frr_ads_04.instructions:
Providers MUST share _authorization data_ with all necessary parties without interruption, including at least FedRAMP, CISA, and agency customers. 


Technical Assistance:
"Without interruption" means that parties should not have to request manual approval each time they need to access _authorization data_ or go through a complicated process. The preferred way of ensuring access without interruption is to use on-demand just-in-time access provisioning.

ads_base_frr_ads_05.name: Responsible Information Sharing
ads_base_frr_ads_05.description: FedRAMP ADS > Base. Impact Levels: Low, Moderate, High
ads_base_frr_ads_05.instructions:
Providers MUST provide sufficient information in _authorization data_ to support authorization decisions but SHOULD NOT include sensitive information that would _likely_ enable a threat actor to gain unauthorized access, cause harm, disrupt operations, or otherwise have a negative adverse impact on the _cloud service offering_. 


Technical Assistance:
This is not a license to exclude accurate risk information, but specifics that would _likely_ lead to compromise should be abstracted. A breach of confidentiality with _authorization data_ should be anticipated by a secure cloud service provider.

ads_base_frr_ads_06.name: USDA Connect Community Portal
ads_base_frr_ads_06.description: FedRAMP ADS > Base. Impact Levels: Low, Moderate, High
ads_base_frr_ads_06.instructions: Providers of FedRAMP Rev5 Authorized _cloud service offerings_ MUST share _authorization data_ via the USDA Connect Community Portal UNLESS they use a FedRAMP-compatible _trust center_.

ads_base_frr_ads_07.name: FedRAMP-Compatible Trust Centers
ads_base_frr_ads_07.description: FedRAMP ADS > Base. Impact Levels: Low, Moderate, High
ads_base_frr_ads_07.instructions: Providers of FedRAMP 20x Authorized _cloud service offerings_ MUST use a FedRAMP-compatible _trust center_ to store and share _authorization data_ with all necessary parties.

ads_base_frr_ads_08.name: Trust Center Migration Notification
ads_base_frr_ads_08.description: FedRAMP ADS > Base. Impact Levels: Low, Moderate, High
ads_base_frr_ads_08.instructions: Providers MUST notify all necessary parties when migrating to a _trust center_ and MUST provide information in their existing USDA Connect Community Portal secure folders explaining how to use the _trust center_ to obtain _authorization data_.

ads_base_frr_ads_09.name: Historical Authorization Data
ads_base_frr_ads_09.description: FedRAMP ADS > Base. Impact Levels: Low, Moderate, High
ads_base_frr_ads_09.instructions: Providers MUST make historical versions of _authorization data_ available for three years to all necessary parties UNLESS otherwise specified by applicable FedRAMP requirements; deltas between versions MAY be consolidated quarterly.

ads_base_frr_ads_10.name: Best Practices and Technical Assistance
ads_base_frr_ads_10.description: FedRAMP ADS > Base. Impact Levels: Low, Moderate, High
ads_base_frr_ads_10.instructions: Providers SHOULD follow FedRAMPâ€™s best practices and technical assistance for sharing _authorization data_ where applicable.

ads_access_control_frr_ads_ac_01.name: Public Guidance
ads_access_control_frr_ads_ac_01.description: FedRAMP ADS > Access Control. Impact Levels: Low, Moderate, High
ads_access_control_frr_ads_ac_01.instructions: Providers MUST publicly provide plain-language policies and guidance for all necessary parties that explains how they can obtain and manage access to _authorization data_ stored in the _trust center_.

ads_access_control_frr_ads_ac_02.name: Prospective Customer Access
ads_access_control_frr_ads_ac_02.description: FedRAMP ADS > Access Control. Impact Levels: Low, Moderate, High
ads_access_control_frr_ads_ac_02.instructions: Providers SHOULD share at least the _authorization package_ with prospective agency customers upon request and MUST notify FedRAMP within five business days if a prospective agency customer request is denied.

ads_trust_center_frr_ads_tc_01.name: Trust Center Assessment
ads_trust_center_frr_ads_tc_01.description: FedRAMP ADS > Trust Center. Impact Levels: Low, Moderate, High
ads_trust_center_frr_ads_tc_01.instructions: _Trust centers_ MUST be included as an _information resource_ included in the _cloud service offering_ for assessment if FRR-MAS-01 applies.

ads_trust_center_frr_ads_tc_02.name: Human and Machine-Readable
ads_trust_center_frr_ads_tc_02.description: FedRAMP ADS > Trust Center. Impact Levels: Low, Moderate, High
ads_trust_center_frr_ads_tc_02.instructions: _Trust centers_ SHOULD make _authorization data_ available to view and download in both human-readable and _machine-readable_ formats

ads_trust_center_frr_ads_tc_03.name: Programmatic Access
ads_trust_center_frr_ads_tc_03.description: FedRAMP ADS > Trust Center. Impact Levels: Low, Moderate, High
ads_trust_center_frr_ads_tc_03.instructions: _Trust centers_ MUST provide documented programmatic access to all _authorization data_, including programmatic access to human-readable materials.

ads_trust_center_frr_ads_tc_04.name: Self-Service Access Management
ads_trust_center_frr_ads_tc_04.description: FedRAMP ADS > Trust Center. Impact Levels: Low, Moderate, High
ads_trust_center_frr_ads_tc_04.instructions: _Trust centers_ SHOULD include features that encourage all necessary parties to provision and manage access to _authorization data_ for their users and services directly.

ads_trust_center_frr_ads_tc_05.name: Access Inventory
ads_trust_center_frr_ads_tc_05.description: FedRAMP ADS > Trust Center. Impact Levels: Low, Moderate, High
ads_trust_center_frr_ads_tc_05.instructions: _Trust centers_ MUST maintain an inventory and history of federal agency users or systems with access to _authorization data_ and MUST make this information available to FedRAMP without interruption.

ads_trust_center_frr_ads_tc_06.name: Access Logging
ads_trust_center_frr_ads_tc_06.description: FedRAMP ADS > Trust Center. Impact Levels: Low, Moderate, High
ads_trust_center_frr_ads_tc_06.instructions: _Trust centers_ MUST log access to _authorization data_ and store summaries of access for at least six months; such information, as it pertains to specific parties, SHOULD be made available upon request by those parties.

ads_trust_center_frr_ads_tc_07.name: Responsive Performance
ads_trust_center_frr_ads_tc_07.description: FedRAMP ADS > Trust Center. Impact Levels: Low, Moderate, High
ads_trust_center_frr_ads_tc_07.instructions: _Trust centers_ SHOULD deliver responsive performance during normal operating conditions and minimize service disruptions.

ads_exceptions_frr_ads_ex_01.name: Legacy Self-Managed Repository Exception
ads_exceptions_frr_ads_ex_01.description: FedRAMP ADS > Exceptions. Impact Levels: Low, Moderate, High
ads_exceptions_frr_ads_ex_01.instructions: Providers of FedRAMP Rev5 Authorized _cloud service offerings_ at FedRAMP High using a legacy self-managed repository for _authorization data_ MAY ignore the requirements in this standard until future notice.
